data.text:
Successful 13-year @unpeacekeeping / @_AfricanUnion mission in Darfur closes on Thursday after:
- Supporting the peace process
- Protecting civilians
- Facilitating delivery of humanitarian assistance

See other @unamidnews achievements: https://t.co/8gpSADt5M8 #ServingForPeace https://t.co/XVgOvO3yBo

"Making peace with nature is the defining task of the 21st century. It must be the top, top priority for everyone, everywhere." -- @antonioguterres

As we prepare to welcome #NewYear2021, resolve to protect our planet & our future. https://t.co/vg9uSygy7a #ClimateAction https://t.co/hdqBz2AH9U

Brave women & men have been #ServingForPeace during the past 13 years with @unamidnews, which wraps up its mandate on Thursday. 

More on their important work: https://t.co/v5R3snGy2X https://t.co/lJ9KQ5rfEv

Loss of biodiversity threatens everyone by increasing emergence of zoonotic diseases like #COVID19. 

The UN Decade of Biodiversity is coming to an end, but you can continue to take action #ForNature - to protect our health, our economies & future. https://t.co/e5lxL5WPWm https://t.co/IAYEzTQgBS

One country - one vote.

As we marked #UN75 this year, our colleagues from the UN Audiovisual Library explained how the General Assembly works.

They dug through 75 years of audiovisual heritage to bring you some #UNGA trivia. https://t.co/Nc0pqp6pCR #YearInReview https://t.co/kHNpTJh1wB

#YearInReview: From @antonioguterres' visit to Pakistan in February, to decontamination efforts in Mali due to #COVID19, @UN_Photo shows the UN's work around the world in 2020. https://t.co/OlvP83Re5O https://t.co/bdPrnsa5Vc

More than 1.3 million people die in road accidents every year.

The Decade of Action for Road Safety is coming to an end, but you can continue to save lives:
👉 Don’t speed
👉 Never drink 🍷 & drive 🚗
👉 Wear a 🏍 helmet
👉 Use a seat belt

https://t.co/xXCH4mf6sl via @WHO https://t.co/66HFJLubDP

"This unacceptable act of violence is a tragic reminder of the importance of bringing Yemen urgently back on the path towards peace."

-- @OSE_Yemen Martin Griffiths strongly condemns Wednesday’s deadly attack on Aden airport. https://t.co/QmdNou0A33
https://t.co/FvphYDJrNL
https://t.co/0fAFjkCBwO
https://t.co/x5491lnIfX
https://t.co/och4cIxbvX

"It is time to stop trying to change women, and start changing the systems that prevent them from achieving their potential."

Early this year, @antonioguterres called for an urgent redistribution of power to achieve gender equality. https://t.co/yqLNEUyfo9 #YearInReview https://t.co/C5MHSnavyD

10.4 million children in Democratic Republic of the Congo, Nigeria, Central Sahel, South Sudan & Yemen will suffer from acute malnutrition in 2021 due to dire humanitarian crises, worsened by #COVID19. 

@UNICEF calls for urgent action to support them. https://t.co/Qll9TPU53j

Every day, health workers provide essential care services & save lives, including on the frontlines of the #COVID19 response.

The Year of the Nurse & the Midwife is coming to an end, but you can continue to show solidarity and #SupportNursesAndMidwives: https://t.co/kEvBV7QqUn https://t.co/9BOw0vYjC3

"We must stamp out the horrifying increase in violence against women & girls during the #COVID19 pandemic. This is a hidden war on women."

-- @antonioguterres at #UNGA in September. https://t.co/qBHRKoFRWQ #YearInReview https://t.co/ru5zssuMNa

#YearInReview:

50,000+ images from 130+ countries were submitted to #TheWorldWeWant photo contest to celebrate the 75th anniversary of the UN this year.

📸 Have a look at the 75 amazing finalists in this virtual exhibit: https://t.co/dzBgfDyXqu https://t.co/Qi482yOSmo

A special 360-video created for this year's 75th #UNGA, features memorable moments on one of the world’s most recognizable political stages. 

Explore it here: https://t.co/UurD6OnCaG #YearInReview https://t.co/3DidORNw8a

Learn to recognize the signs of an abusive relationship. 

@UN_Women explains how everyone can help end violence against women & support victims: https://t.co/oeaiWJ2zpC #GenerationEquality https://t.co/aN5Yhe1m7b

#YearInReview: 2020 marked 40 years since smallpox, one of the deadliest diseases ever known to humans, was officially eradicated.

Amid #COVID19, it is a reminder of how international health cooperation can achieve significant & lasting good. https://t.co/sMNkexie51 via @WHO https://t.co/62Zp26GBE7

#COVID19 has exposed the lie that free markets can deliver healthcare for all, the fiction that unpaid care work isn't work, the delusion that we live in a post-racist world.

-- @antonioguterres on #MandelaDay in July. https://t.co/SMsAmNWXdO #YearInReview https://t.co/xrnQXY6Uy0

Hundreds of millions of students have been impacted by school closures due to #COVID19 this year.

See how the UN & partners helped promote innovative communication tools to help children stay connected & learning during the crisis.
https://t.co/9K17QYiGCQ

"Even today, there are many boardrooms I walk into & people won't recognise that I'm the Executive Director of a UN agency."

-- @UNFPA chief @Atayeshe shares her personal experience with racism & her lifelong commitment to fighting it on Awake At Night. https://t.co/9QPNDPL0f3 https://t.co/qPZaSxbvfb

"The United Nations not only stands with you -- the United Nations belongs to you, and is you."

Marking #UN75 this year, @antonioguterres has called on the world to unite & realize our shared vision of a better future for all. #YearInReview https://t.co/X8Bfn1Oy1X

This has been a year of trials, tragedies and tears.

But a New Year lies ahead. And with it, we see rays of hope. 

Let's make 2021 a year of healing.

-- @antonioguterres in his New Year message. 

https://t.co/nSm7JGzA05

Protecting plant health can help:
🌱End hunger
🌱Reduce poverty
🌱Protect the environment
🌱Boost economic development.

As the Int'l Year of #PlantHealth comes to an end, let's continue to raise awareness about the importance of healthy plants. https://t.co/33mSYgVY39 via @FAO https://t.co/TZfBal8LKr

To brighten up the end of a difficult year, singers from Brazil have created a song that inspires unity & solidarity to help overcome the intense challenges caused by #COVID19.

Share this song to help bring this message of hope to more people. https://t.co/NCuWk5Xjkt

The UN turned 75 this year, providing an opportunity for everyone to reflect on how to work together for a better future. 

See what people around the world said is important to them in the  #UN75 survey: https://t.co/W9E0NUJtzN #YearInReview https://t.co/ftLCK5jbqj

5,600 trucks 🚚
650 warehouses 🏚️
92 aircraft ✈️
50 ships 🚢

Every day, @WFP uses its impressive logistics capacity to help the most vulnerable affected by emergencies & humanitarian crises. https://t.co/NwVbQ9fbpu

https://t.co/EvsGQlrxFl

Throughout the pandemic, bicycles helped transform mobility, while also helping to lay the foundation for a greener, more sustainable recovery.

See how the UN helped support the use of bicycles & other forms of #ClimateAction. https://t.co/Bn8Oxx0wEV

For 75 years, the UN has been helping people around the world live more peaceful & prosperous lives. 

Take a look back at 75 images that capture our work from @UN_Photo. https://t.co/x5HYVpvkXI #UN75 https://t.co/MEI364VoWK

"If we are lucky enough to be sitting in a place that is safe & dry our job is to try to give that to other people who don't have that."

@UNODC's @NeilWalsh_UN shares his personal story of strength & inspiration with @MelissaFleming on Awake At Night. https://t.co/vFw01dguGJ https://t.co/JSrsGbiBfn

"Making peace with nature is the defining task of the 21st century. It must be the top, top priority for everyone, everywhere."

-- @antonioguterres called for urgent #ClimateAction earlier this month. https://t.co/1ilJUqpgy2 #YearInReview https://t.co/vux6svGNaM

🧊 Icebergs, 🌩 lightnings, 🌈 rainbows, 🌀supercells...

... just some of the protagonists of this year’s @WMO photo competition. 

Check out all the images showcasing ocean, climate & weather that will appear in WMO 2021 calendar: https://t.co/hupZp3TCPR https://t.co/iLH9YzrKRi

A lack of digital connectivity poses challenges for communities trying to stop the spread of #COVID19.

See how the UN has used everything from bicycles to loudspeakers to help educate people & counter misinformation during the pandemic. 

https://t.co/c7iHisDtTC https://t.co/tueM9uH7zr

With support from @IAMJHUD, Kate Winslet & @baobabstudios, #BabaYagaVR is helping us highlight the importance of protecting our planet's natural resources. 

Every #ClimateAction counts. 

Explore the virtual reality journey with the #ActNow app: https://t.co/4i2kqgHfrb https://t.co/YM14ugrs3K

The Universal Declaration of Human Rights has helped improve the lives of millions of people and lay the foundations for a more just world.

Today & every day, #StandUp4HumanRights. https://t.co/2ftXxLBj0g https://t.co/VUAFzZNEwf

Major infectious diseases & epidemics have devastating impacts on people's lives everywhere.

To avoid future, more dangerous pandemics, we need to focus on prevention. More on Sunday's International Day of Epidemic Preparedness: https://t.co/bRoA1a6kde https://t.co/ZuD4Zp7s9i

"When we are willing, our capacity for positive change is limitless." 

-- @UNFCCC chief @PEspinosaC reflects on 2020, #COVID19 and #ClimateAction in @_UNChronicle.
https://t.co/8P4xoNPQ0j

Ending the #COVID19 crisis and building a safer, healthier future requires investing in health systems that protect all people, everywhere. 

More on Sunday's first-ever International Day of Epidemic Preparedness: https://t.co/bRoA1a6kde https://t.co/bktxdXmjSj

#COVID19 has triggered unprecedented global health, humanitarian, socio-economic & human rights crises, exacerbating the vulnerabilities of children.

@UNICEF is working to build a better future for every child in conflict & crisis. https://t.co/lphh4zhVit

#COVID19 has shown the importance of strengthening epidemic prevention to avoid global health crises.

Sunday is the first-ever International Day of Epidemic Preparedness. https://t.co/bRoA19OJlG https://t.co/II9JZnvQIk

The recovery from #COVID19 presents an opportunity to set our economies and societies on a green path in line with the #GlobalGoals. 

-- @antonioguterres called for urgent #ClimateAction at the Climate Ambition Summit earlier this month: https://t.co/BqfE9fl1u8 #YearInReview https://t.co/RsIKc59Xg0

This year, @WFP was awarded the #NobelPeacePrize.

In our podcast, @WFPChief speaks about what inspires their work:

"I don't go to bed at night thinking about the children we saved. I go to bed at night thinking about the children we couldn't get to." https://t.co/VPLKbyWeoS https://t.co/nztZt807ri

1 in 33 people around the world will need humanitarian assistance in 2021 -- that's a 40% increase since the beginning of this year.

The UN & humanitarian partners will need $35 billion to reach the most vulnerable. https://t.co/5ZU9ckqPpq #InvestInHumanity https://t.co/1zvJaVH1mb

Education is a human right, not a privilege.

As the Convention against Discrimination in Education turns 60 this year, learn more about @UNESCO's work to ensure everyone's #RightToEducation. https://t.co/FXNDvSpdZB #StandUp4HumanRights https://t.co/xAzwkx09DX

A healthy tourism industry is essential for the global economy, culture and environment.

#COVID19 response is an opportunity to rethink and reshape how we travel to do it in a more sustainable way. #ClimateAction
https://t.co/cOSzskmwmU

"How can I tell my granddaughters that their granddaughters’ granddaughters will still be paid less than a man for the same work?" 

In February, @antonioguterres called for an urgent redistribution of power to achieve gender equality. https://t.co/yqLNEUyfo9 #YearInReview https://t.co/FchpAuSnmF

Children already at risk of violence may find themselves even more vulnerable amid #COVID19.

Access to social services & mental health support must be a key part of every government's response plan, urges @UNICEF. https://t.co/zlJIVxqQVe #ENDviolence 

🎨: Rizka, 19, Indonesia https://t.co/QnhtSW7T5t

#COVID19 has demonstrated the interconnected nature of our world – and that no one is safe until everyone is safe.  

See how people showed solidarity & acts of humanity this past year to save lives & lay the foundation to recover better from the pandemic. https://t.co/oAJhpG9pg7

Let music for peace
Be the paradigm,
For peace means to change
At the right time.

During this year's #UNGA, W.H. Auden’s “Hymn to the United Nations” expressed the power of hope for a better future. #UN75 #YearInReview https://t.co/tDaNYMZZqX

"This is a moment of truth for people & planet alike. #COVID19 & climate have brought us to a threshold."

Earlier this month, @antonioguterres stressed the need for a safer, more sustainable & equitable path into the future. https://t.co/deUv1Ti3Wm #ClimateAction #YearInReview https://t.co/k3woUTGVbA

Physical distancing during #COVID19 does not have to mean social or emotional isolation.

Stay connected with your family & friends. 

We are in this together & we will get through this together. 

🎨: @LeyahMedia https://t.co/RvJEugVPkJ

#FBF to 2014 when children displaced from their homes by violence and conflict in South Sudan sang Christmas carols in the capital, Juba.

Get details on @UNPeacekeeping's work there from @unmissmedia: https://t.co/QwFV5n8lAK https://t.co/3fxzsQDmfz

#YearInReview: On this year's #UNDay in October, we marked 75 years of making a difference in the lives of people everywhere. 

It may not always make the headlines — but the UN works all over the world to prevent conflict and keep peace & stability. https://t.co/uKqX2tHgU7 #UN75 https://t.co/SL3qX87QQV

During this holiday season, give the gift of food on behalf of your family & friends and make a difference in someone's life. 

Help @WFP feed the hungry via @ShareTheMealorg. https://t.co/c3SjInZdW8 #ZeroHunger
https://t.co/PCtVsp0F3j

The climate crisis has not stopped amid #COVID19. Delaying #ClimateAction costs livelihoods and lives.

We need a systemic shift to a more sustainable economy that works for people and the planet. https://t.co/vg9uSxYXfC https://t.co/s2YltKNRop

#YearinReview: Our colleagues at @WFP were awarded the #NobelPeacePrize for their tireless efforts in achieving #ZeroHunger.

Learn more about the work of the world's largest humanitarian organization fighting hunger: https://t.co/1Xy24GskrU https://t.co/QZTWPAMUac

"We are scientific fighters. We are not fighting with bullets. Our arms are our knowledge."

-- After 2 years on the frontlines of the Ebola response, @WHO's  @MR_Belizaire is now fighting #COVID19 in Central African Republic. Listen to her story: https://t.co/33pdrN2eNQ https://t.co/KCExhs8GaK

"The impact of #COVID19 is not only taking away our loved ones but also taking with them a part of our history."

-- As indigenous communities continue to be disproportionately affected by the pandemic, artist @titoferrara pays homage to the elders lost to #coronavirus. https://t.co/RLxwGxfvmW

"Making peace with nature is the defining task of the 21st century. 
It must be the top, top priority for everyone, everywhere."

-- @antonioguterres called for urgent #ClimateAction. https://t.co/1ilJUqpgy2 #YearInReview https://t.co/QuCZb67nDZ

🛒 Buy only what you need
❄️ Freeze & eat leftovers
🥧 Share the food you won’t eat with others

During this holiday season, we can all do our part to help #StopTheWaste. @WFP has more tips: https://t.co/sXuAko2Hc3 https://t.co/I5J3I6b7WK

The economic impacts of #COVID19 put pressure on education budgets & aid at a time when students need more support than ever.

@UNESCO calls for scaled up efforts to ensure inclusive, quality education. https://t.co/vSNaV6v1MM https://t.co/TnvRYCaR9j

2020 marked 40 years since smallpox was officially eradicated.

The lessons learned from that success can help fight #COVID19, including the importance of uniting the world behind science & the power of public health measures. https://t.co/sMNkexie51

https://t.co/iWIQw6COT6

Our choices matter.
Our actions count.
Use the new #ActNow @Instagram face filter to spread the word about how you are helping to protect the planet and build a more sustainable world: https://t.co/Dg1yMJxpVc #ClimateAction

https://t.co/pVZPNbBVob

"#COVID19 is a human tragedy.
But it has also created a generational opportunity.
An opportunity to build back a more equal & sustainable world."

-- @antonioguterres in annual @NelsonMandela lecture on #MandelaDay in July. https://t.co/SMsAmNFlPe #YearInReview https://t.co/UDwLD1vfIQ

Shadow pandemic: Here's how @UNinIndia has responded to the increase in violence against women & girls during #COVID19, often hidden due to restricted mobility & limited access to essential services. https://t.co/MRRRnKzBQ7 via @UN_SDG https://t.co/XipKwFiYYi

#YearInReview: At #UNGA, @UNICEF supporters @BTS_twt shared their struggles during #COVID19 in a heartfelt message of solidarity with young people around the world. https://t.co/iMWOIMqj0y https://t.co/6YNSSiBcy8

With the JCPOA Iran nuclear agreement countries showed that dialogue & diplomacy - supported by a united Security Council - could forge a path to resolving the issue. We hope they & the Council can do so again.

-- @UNDPPA chief @DicarloRosemary. https://t.co/lehLkCKp12

🎁 Looking for meaningful gifts this holiday season? 💝 

@Refugees has 5️⃣ ideas that give back and help people who were forced to flee their home.  https://t.co/zeRaP2IS3F https://t.co/d2SmEwGgBL

🔺Conflict across 40+ frontlines
🔺Rising food prices 
🔺Currency in decline

Millions in Yemen are living through the world’s worst humanitarian disaster – with #COVID19 exacerbating existing crises. 

Support @WFP's life-saving efforts there. https://t.co/jHnPHVHiaa https://t.co/PNesukgtVJ

Nurses & midwives make up the largest group of healthcare workers in the world - and they are on the frontlines of the #COVID19 response. 

#SupportNursesAndMidwives and show solidarity with people everywhere by following public health advice.  https://t.co/1DVI8bWFwF https://t.co/P60ZmkPBZT

Vaccine storage
Hygiene facilitates
Food aide 

The UN family supports the fight against #COVID19 in many ways.  
See some examples in our latest @TwitterMoments: 
https://t.co/e9ghdUWEw9

"We don't go to sleep if we haven't finished doing everything that we can to solve the problem, to rescue a person, to allow a refugee to have access to safety."

🎧 More from @Refugees Chief @FilippoGrandi about what inspires his work every day: https://t.co/v0J6m0Hak8 https://t.co/F0aFj1ZYzr

“The Middle East Quartet – alongside Arab partners – and Israeli and Palestinian leaders, must work together to return to the path of meaningful negotiations,” UN envoy @nmladenov tells Security Council. https://t.co/meTnpAzsEG

The presence of UN peacekeepers in conflicts helps reduce the number of deaths among civilians & combatants. 

@UNPeacekeeping explains how women & men are #ServingForPeace and protecting lives around the world: https://t.co/qy3UiSZKHA #A4P https://t.co/IIcXlPQCzz

Doctors, nurses and specialists have been working around the clock to fight the pandemic and save lives.

Dr. Ajibola Ojikutu shares his experience treating #COVID19 patients in Nigeria. https://t.co/CWyBYXskft

Healthy ecosystems can mitigate 1/3 of greenhouse gas emissions.

The #ClimateAction we take now will impact the lives of people around the world - now and in the future. https://t.co/Nvl0LyI1N0 https://t.co/8SpqSzfAMH

"We will never, ever give up making this world better for everyone, everywhere."

-- @antonioguterres summing up the mission of the UN as the Organization turned 75 this year.

More about our work: https://t.co/PY3Cb6a8uL #UN75 https://t.co/mSzy84Ea4p

Physical distancing does not have to mean social or emotional isolation.

Stay connected to your loved ones. 
We are in this together -- and we will get through this together.

🎨: Illustras Atelier https://t.co/Hk6MHOa4MJ

Women's rights are human rights!

For a decade, @UN_Women has been working for gender quality & women's empowerment.

Learn more about their efforts to protect & promote the rights of women & girls everywhere: https://t.co/SHg6BJ7nvY #GenerationEquality https://t.co/1nuipTjOVv

Year in Review: In 2020, we marked 75 years of working for & with people around the 🌍 , in the midst of an unprecedented crisis.

At #UNGA, @antonioguterres stressed the value of unity that led to the creation of the UN in 1945 & remains more important than ever. https://t.co/CzmWgcaumt

🧪 #COVID19 vaccine for everyone 
🌏 A thriving planet
🍛 Food for all
♻️ Clean energy
🤝 International cooperation

We have a chance to recover better. Decide #ItsPossible https://t.co/j4SVI5nQK8 https://t.co/cZizFZCHic

#COVID19 has shown how important it is to listen to scientists and spread verified information. 

Be a #ClimateAction Superhero - help counter climate change misinformation with true facts and scientific evidence. https://t.co/nAjeCAHlAC #ActNow https://t.co/41IWbtYZuZ

The #GlobalGoals are our blueprint to achieve a better & more sustainable future for all. Making them a reality requires global cooperation & solidarity.

On Sunday's #SolidarityDay & every day, take action for a better world! https://t.co/qCGnLujSjv https://t.co/8rVadC9tnf

"Out of everything I've done so far in my life, this initiative is maybe one of the things I am most proud of."

Bestar is one of the young cyclists who delivered 600+ face masks to help stop the spread of #COVID19, with support from @UNMIKosovo.
https://t.co/xUmKXWrEjD

The worldwide response to #COVID19 has demonstrated the power of solidarity. People are spreading kindness through their words & deeds -- while inspiring others to do the same.

Join them on Sunday's #SolidarityDay! https://t.co/qCGnLuBtI5

🎨: @megatoeDesign https://t.co/e1gk8Znmah

#COVID19 has affected human rights around the world.

Take the @UNHumanRights quiz & learn about the impact of the pandemic on gender equality, health rights, climate & worker protection: https://t.co/LkUlLQktCn #StandUp4HumanRights https://t.co/kSQh8STMkZ

"Solidarity is humanity. Solidarity is survival." -- @antonioguterres

Let's focus on promoting solidarity and helping those in need, especially amid #COVID19 and other crises. 

Sunday is #SolidarityDay: https://t.co/qCGnLuBtI5 https://t.co/bkCy1mT7G0

Year in Review: In September, the UN presented #𝘕𝘢𝘵𝘪𝘰𝘯𝘴𝘜𝘯𝘪𝘵𝘦𝘥. 

This first-of-its-kind film explores the solutions & action needed to tackle the biggest issues facing humanity, from #COVID19 & the climate crisis to poverty & inequality.

https://t.co/lNTRnhFA4l

COVAX is the global effort to coordinate #COVID19 vaccine production and distribution. 

Until all of us are safe, none of us are safe.

Together, we can rebuild a better world. #ItsPossible. https://t.co/j4SVI56fSA https://t.co/RzeaR3yKRd

“No country in the world has yet achieved very high human development without putting immense strain on the planet. But we could be the first generation to right this wrong."

-- @ASteiner on latest @UNDP Human Development Report. https://t.co/xrCPFPUajB #HDR2020 https://t.co/t3sT7X7vuY

Ensuring equitable global vaccine delivery, making masks for the community & donating medical equipment are just some of the acts of solidarity that help people around the world amid #COVID19.  

See more examples in our @TwitterMoments: 
https://t.co/o8MLptF8Dj

This is a time for taking comfort that the end of the #COVID19 pandemic is in sight - but taking care that we do not let down our guard.

-- @WHO chief @DrTedros. https://t.co/xfUhsTQfxq

#VaccinesWork, are safe & help prevent millions of deaths every year. 

Together, we can end the #COVID19 pandemic. https://t.co/d1dwJgGYgy https://t.co/g03cBF1tQF
